page.title: 15Trade in Marr and Brodsworth
page.content: The village{shop}at Brodsworth is run by Miss Rawding known to the village as Gracie.Gracie's is the village {"supermarket"}because she sells almost everything and has the best one penny selection of things in our area.Gracie is very kind and if you are one or two pence short she gives you the thing that you want.On Tuesdays and Thursdays our school goes down to Gracie's{shop}to buy some sweets.The {Post Office}at Marr is in a house like Gracie's but apart from postal things it only sells pop an crisps. There is a farm{shop}at Marr which is open in the summer for passing{trade. There has been trouble because of people selling farm produce in laybys. Old people who find it fairly difficult to get things locally have to travel to the larger towns on the bus,not always easy for old people.
